Kongres PSSI, Benhard Limbong Pesimis Terpilih Sebagai Ketua
01 Nov 2019, 12:09 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Calon Ketua Umum PSSI, Benhard Limbong, mengaku pesimis mampu meraih suara mayoritas dalam Kongres Luar Biasa di Hotel Shangri-la, Sabtu, 2 November 2019. Mantan Ketua Komisi Disiplin PSSI ini menduga tradisi lama untuk pemilihan ketua umum masih digunakan oleh para pemilik suara atau voters.
"Semacam money politic ku lihat gitu," kata dia saat dihubungi Tempo, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Awalnya, kata Benhard, lebih dari 10 voters PSSI telah membangun komitmen memberi dukungan dalam kongres. Ia mengatakan, sebenarnya tak mau menuduh macam-macam kepada voters yang telah membangun komitmen. Tapi, dia melanjutkan, menjelang KLB, mereka sulit dihubungi. "Ada apa? Kemarin-kemarin yang bersangkutan hubungi terus, tiba-tiba dihubungi enggak bisa lagi," kata dia.
Ia menduga peluangnya menjadi ketua umum PSSI mengecil karena jumlah dukungan yang telah dikumpulkan tergerus sebanyak 50 persen. Walaupun peluangnya untuk mendapatkan suara mayoritas kecil, Benhard tetap akan datang ke KLB karena cinta sama sepak bola dan PSSI.
"Suaranya dikasih ke siapa saya tidak tahu, enggak boleh nuduh," kata dia menjelaskan suaranya yang telah beralih ke calon lainnya.
Dalam KLB PSSI kali ini, ada sebelas calon yang bersaing memperebutkan kursi Ketua Umum PSSI periode 2019-2023. Mereka adalah Arif Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Bernhard Limbong, Benny Erwin, Fary Djemy Francis. Lalu, La Nyalla Mattalitti, Mochamad Iriawan, Rahim Soekasah, Sarman El Hakim, Vijaya Fitriyasa, dan Yesayas Oktavianus.
Selain memilih Ketua Umum PSSI, kongres pemilihan ini juga akan memilih dua Wakil Ketua Umum PSSI dan 12 anggota Komite Eksekutif (Exco) PSSI.

IRSYAN HASYIM

PSSI Congress, Benhard Limbong Pessimists Elected as Chairman
01 Nov 2019, 12:09 PM by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PSSI Chairman Candidate Benhard Limbong said he was pessimistic that he could win a majority in the Extraordinary Congress at the Shangri-la Hotel, Saturday, November 2, 2019. The former Chairperson of the PSSI Disciplinary Commission suspected that the old tradition of electing the chairman was still used by voters or voters.
"I see that kind of money politics," he said when contacted by Tempo, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Initially, said Benhard, more than 10 PSSI voters had built commitments to support the congress. He said, actually did not want to accuse various kinds of voters who had built commitments. But, he continued, ahead of the KLB, they were difficult to contact. "What's wrong? Yesterday, the person concerned continued to contact, suddenly contacted could not be anymore," he said.
He suspects that his chances of becoming PSSI's chairman are diminished because the amount of support that has been collected has been reduced by 50 percent. Even though his chances of getting a small majority of votes, Benhard will still come to KLB because he loves football and PSSI.
"His voice was given to whom I did not know, no accusation could be made," he said, explaining his voice had turned to other candidates.
In the PSSI KLB this time, there were eleven candidates competing for the 2019-2023 PSSI General Chair seats. They are Arif Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Bernhard Limbong, Benny Erwin, Fary Djemy Francis. Then, La Nyalla Mattalitti, Mochamad Iriawan, Rahim Soekasah, Sarman El Hakim, Vijaya Fitriyasa, and Yesayas Oktavianus.
In addition to electing the PSSI Chairperson, this election congress will also elect two PSSI Vice Chairpersons and 12 PSSI Executive Committee (Exco) members.

IRSYAN HASYIM
